snippet: Although Kerry Kennedy on Friday was found not guilty of driving while drugged, she said the 20-month-long prosecution distracted her from her human rights work and her family.
abstract: Kerry Kennedy speaks of her 20-month-long prosecution for driving while drugged that ended with acquittal in Westchester court by six-person jury; says case has taken its toll distracting her from her human rights work and from her family; says experience has made her wonder how often such prosecutions ensnare innocent people.
lead_paragraph: Although Kerry Kennedy on Friday was found not guilty of driving while drugged, she said the 20-month-long prosecution distracted her from her human rights work and her family.

headline.main: Impaired-Driving Case Took Toll, Kennedy Says
headline.print_headline: Impaired-Driving Case Took Toll, Kennedy Says
